kernel.title: KERNEL
kernel.def: The core component of an OS. It manages system resources and communication between hardware and software.

wsl.title: WSL
wsl.def: Windows Subsystem for Linux. A compatibility layer for running Linux binary executables natively on Windows.

distro.title: DISTRIBUTION
distro.def: An operating system made from a software collection based on the Linux kernel and a package management system.

shell.title: SHELL
shell.def: A computer program which exposes an operating system's services to a human user or other program.

glassmorphism.title: GLASSMORPHISM
glassmorphism.def: A UI design trend emphasizing light/dark mode transparency, background blur, and floating layered objects.

hud.title: HUD
hud.def: Heads-Up Display. A transparent display that presents data without requiring users to look away from their usual viewpoints.

telemetry.title: TELEMETRY
telemetry.def: The automatic recording and transmission of data from remote or inaccessible sources to an IT system.

buffer.title: BUFFER
buffer.def: A region of physical memory storage used to temporarily store data while it is being moved from one place to another.
